text: the hero image on the last blog post is way too big pixel-wise for the animation it’s trying to convey. it chugs on my computer, (it’s 3200x1280, should probably be closer to 1080p max if we’re looking for animation, and if we want animated headers we should look at <video> headers for the future
again, as always: general feedback, not an action item
not sure where else to put these :slightly_smiling_face:

Not needed for today — but general question: Did our image size requirements change at all when we did some work on the site? Things like the blog thumbnails, hero images, etc — dimension wise, did those change at all?
oh that’s much better! and sorry, i wasn’t trying to make anyone jump on it
Working on process on image size guidelines/optimizing before posting to web. Thanks <@U243UT96G>
Thank you, <@U243UT96G>. And it's good to know <@U06DFL7BP> because other people would have likely had the same problem. Thank you.
